content: Gosh, the story is incredible. Helped inspire me to make my own, both this and Brightridge. I love the game and gave been playing for a year with no major concerns. 10/10 would recommend but I dont have friends ;)
Next thing that would help, just overall performance boost, I know that there's many graphical options to help with FPS but a bit more would help

Beautiful open world with an interesting storyline throughout. Run around & simply explore fantastical landscapes at your leisure or dig into the story and complete dungeons earning shape-shifting abilities like flying through the sky as a bird or tearing through scenery as a fox or deer. If I had to complain I would say the combat is lacking, but I don't think combat was intended as the main focus of the game. This world was created by a huge team of 1, so I support & give props where due!
Love it

Awesome and a very generous graphical interface game. It is so far the less expensive 3D games I ever pay for. And I am very satisfied with this games. There is a small glitch with the controller a few times. For example during the fight sometimes the weapon controllers move from one side of the screen to the other side, but it is manageable. Keep up the good work.
Great game well worth the time and money I spent on it!
Very good game the story is very unique, control are nice, graphics is good this game is incredible keep it up.

A very well put together game. After purchasing the first one, I had no idea a second one was available, and on sale. As always, I love what's presented and it's an absolute wonder how one person does all of this. My only gripe would be the jumping. It's like I have gunpowder in my shoes and I just blow into the air. Aside that, everything else is amazing. My controls (after editing the drag to look) are fine. I've been hearing of a new game in the works called "Wilderless". Very excited.
Great game. Can't wait to put some hours in on it.
Need 21:9 resolution support.
lag on my galaxy s20
replyContent: I am really sorry about that Richard. I try to make my game run well on all devices but I am not a very good expert in Android and I admit it could be more optimized. If you want I can help you get a refund. Just email me, and even though it didn't;t work out I am glad you tried my game.

content: I thank you for this game. When life got stressful, this was my go to game üëç I hope more games like this come out in the future!
replyContent: I love to hear that. These games have a bit of action but for the most part they are about nature and people, and they come from my passion to create natural virtual worlds and share them. I get this from playing Dungeons and Dragons as a kid:) Theres so much stress in life I think its nice to just explore and relax, and thanks for the 5 stars too!

content: It's pretty but very slow and hard to control. Tapping through the text actually causes the character to move, eventually moving her away from the person she's talking to.
replyContent: I made a note of that for my new game Wilderless because im adding in characters soon and that tip will come in handy:) And thanks for 4 stars even though it wants all good, every star helps me reach more people and that helps me make better games, and just makes me feel good too which is never a bad ting:)

content: I completed the game today on my birthday. I would given this game 10 stars if possible. This is an absolutely incredible game. I'm sure this is made of pure passion for game dev as I can feel the emotion of each character and story itself. How did you create this kind of masterpiece? Please give us tutorials. I have recommended this game to my friends as well. Thank you for creating this game!
replyContent: Thanks Jodel, and Happy Birthday:) You are right, I am very passionate abut creating worlds and 5 star reviews and kind words help motivate me. I am working on some strong updates and expanding these worlds and it is support like yours that will help me do this. I hope you had a fun birthday and thanks again for this.

content: Great game. Even though you now have resolution option right at the start. I still went into the setting and increased a lot of things right off the bat now that i learned from the last game. With a high end phone its pretty great with most of the setting at or near top. I cannot believe this is been out for a year now and i was going through my games and i found the first one. I remember you mentioned a second was in progress. So i searched and here it is. Im not far in yet but its great so fa
replyContent: Thanks so much Colin:) Im figuring out how to update Vandgels even more, and working on my new game Wilderless too. There is so much to do and that's why it means so much to me to get 5 stars and support like this. It really does make a difference especially as a single developer. And Im glad you use the settings, that's what they're there for:)

content: Hypeeee, rush here from a post on Instagram... Been following your update on this game ever since brightridge, of course I needed some time to tweak with the graphic setting but I can't wait to immerse maself onto another masterpiece... Nice one Robertü§üüèªüëçüèª
replyContent: Thank you Fareez! Ive been working really hard on the new game, and figuring out how to update Vandgels and BrightRidge - its tricky because you can't rollback the games if something goes wrong in updating. But Im so glad you have both and that you said such nice things because game design is really hard, and I need that support and love it:)

content: Camera movement was hard to control.
replyContent: I agree:) My new game Wilderless has better camera precisely because of helpful feedback like this. In Options-Controls turn on Use Touchpad Look - it will make the camera easier to control and not so wild. Im testing ways to safely update the game too, and this will be a big focus. Thanks for 3 stars even with issues, it supports me to do better:)

content: I love this game its worth the money I like the story and the the dungeon quests I also like that you can change form and change character a 5 star rate for this game
replyContent: Thanks Devon:) Those 10 dungeon quests were the first things I built after the landscape and it was really challenging. I learned a lot and I hope my next dungeons are even better (my favourite is the underwater one with the whale). I love Shapechanging too, I think its a fun way to explore the world. Thanks for the 5 stars and your support.

content: Nice graphics everything is beautiful.However I want to complain about something whenever I am playing the game when the snow storm comes the game glitches plz fix that plz Thank you

Amazing, didn't know you made a second game but I have to say I have just started and it looks as beautiful as the first. Looking forward to playing this and anything you make in the future. If there is any way to pay for the game I would be happy to

Only played Story Mode so far a decent 3/4 hour campaign with gorgeous visuals. Play ONLY if you are after a relaxing chill out game. A full on action-packed game with plenty of puzzles it is NOT. Just go after the chill factor!!
replyContent: The start is a lot slower than with BrightRIdge so Im glad you can appreciate the chill factor and that's good advice for potential players:) I appreciate the 4 stars too - every star counts and helps support me and my efforts to keep making games. Thanks for playing Mark and for the feedback.

content: Game seems okay, controls are extremely horrible and glitchy a lot of the time, wish I could get a refund its that bad
replyContent: Thanks for playing Michael, and I can help you with a refund, just email me. And for the controls try options-controls: there's an option here to change the camera from a drag move to only moving when you actually move your finger. It might help you - or someone who might read this:)

content: Nice story
I love this game and all the different ways you can change the gameplay!
This game sucks

I believe you remember me. As I promise to buy the second Nimian, because I love the first one. Played not to far yet, so far so good. Definitely a huge improvement from the first one. Thank you for all of your efforts. Keep making this kind of thing üëçüëç
Short but beautifully made 5/5
Didnt save my progress and the movement is so buggy even on minimal graphics which defeats the purpose. Can I get a refund? It sucks losing my progress after a phone call.

I loved the first game and I am currently enjoying this game. The graphics are astonishing. To the developer: would it be possible to add a custom screen resolution option in the game? Also, the save settings option needs improvement (the exact graphics settings are not being loaded when restoring settings). Also, the 30 FPS option is not smooth. Seems the game has frame pacing issues. Sky: The Children of Light is the only game I have played on android which looks smooth when playing at 30 FPS.
replyContent: Thank you for the encouragement, and the feedback. I made sure my new game Wilderless has all these features because of helpful feedback like this:) I hope I can bring those features back to Vandgels too - the saving settings is one of the biggest asks in the game. Children of light is gorgeous - I marvel how they made those billowing clouds.

content: absolutely beautiful. the story, the graphics, the controls, everything fits together almost seamlessly. Ive never enjoyed my stay in a mobile game like this ever. its so immersive, all the subtle details and differences in this game makes it feel real and alive, it takes me back to the days on n64 and playstation. The story is something I think everyone should experience. Please make more, and please make a sequel to this game. for an indie developer, this stuff is mindblowing. and i mean that
replyContent: Banjo Tooie was the first game that blew me away with large levels & lush graphics, I have wonderful n6w memories renting games at blockbuster and playing all night:) I think its that joyful feeling, and playing dungeons and dragons, that is part of my hunger to create and share worlds, so glad when people enjoy it. btw Lefticle is a great name.

content: This is a really great game that was made by one man if the big game company's put half as much of their heart an soul as he did their would be a lot more people gaming just putting alot of money into a game doesn't make a good game. Thanks for such a great game.
The game runs very poorly on even the default graphic setting. There's too much lag for it to be playable.

omg still amazing I love this game. so much to explore and do. enjoying the story and just having a blast.. I can always get into this game I get lost with emotions this is my escape from reality. your awesome for coming up with a game like this gg keep up the good work. :D
I think a sequel of Brightridge? Im a bout to find out. I bought 2 games in 1 day. Thanks man. üòÄüëå

Change my review... I change my mind! I won't a refund. After re-installing the game, my new phone can handle the graphics and framerate although there's a little glitch but honestly, i love and hate this game! XD Sorry for leaving 1 star review and give you a bad review. It was my fault because I'm using the potato phone. Now I'm using snapdragon phone and i can playing. Thanks dev and can't wait for your new games to develop! Cheers!!! XDDDD
Love it

I'm a fellow game dev who got yours as a way to learn what is possible on mobile platforms. What he does here is nothing short of amazing. Gorgeous environments. Extremely customizable settings to make things run super smooth or extremely detailed and gorgeous. I still have a hard time understanding how he accomplishes all this. Amazing, beautiful and fun!
Good game

Wow, simply amazing. From the story, to the graphics, I loved every moment. I couldn't stop playing and every time I would stop, I'd start right back due to the great story. One of the best mobile games I've played. I can't believe even my note 10 plus can't run max settings smoothly so I can only imagine how good it would look then! My only issue is controller support. It worked in the first game but not this one and I'm not sure why. Other than that, great job! Bring on the 3rd game!

The graphic are not working well with my phone at all. I have a note 9 and it looks so bad. I am trying everything possible to make it look okay, but only got it to look like it is snowing and unable to read anything. Kinda sad because it looks like a beautiful game.
Awesome!

I appreciate the effort that must have gone into making this game, however the graphics seem to lack detail, the controls are impossible, the camera is twitchy and horrible; and your only choice for a playable character is dull, cliched, uninspired and gives the game the ambience of teenage Manga novel.
Impressive, beautiful and very immersive. Note: i just got the final treasure, but the final orange pillar didnt disappear and seems i cant do anything at the ascension chamber. Is it intended?
Game gave me a headache, I couldn't play the game, the controls was so bad.
replyContent: You aren't alone - many players love the story and world, but controls was probably the biggest complaint in my game:). Try Options-Controls and switch on One handed controls. This makes the look camera work with a swipe instead of a persistent drag. There may be more options here and in Options-Camera that help too.

content: A game of exploration and wonder. If you like Sky Children of the Light, try this. There are a huge array of configuration options to tailor it to your phone and personal preferences. I'd personally like the jump altered so that it doesn't appear so visually jarring on the eye, straight out of the box.

What just happened? I think you have just realised my childhood dreams on a cellular phone. An Absolute break through in first mobile rpg, ( i would ask for a character creator if possible in future games maybe?) But you must be an absolute genius and this game should be at the 20 to 40 dollar range for what your giving

It was a no brainer buying this after doing a bit of research on it. The fact that one person can create a masterpiece of this caliber is a testament to the gaming community. Those who've given one star ratings didnt give the game a proper chance. Play with the options a bit, and you'll find a fit right for your play style. 4 modes of play, superb graphical design, and seemingly endless exploration make this game a true gem in my collection. Well done!!
replyContent: I really glad you used the options to your advantage Ren - that's what they're there for and I really appreciate what you said. My games aren't perfect but I make them with one side in mind: to share a natural world to explore and bring people out of their everyday for a moment. Thank you for the appreciation and the very supportive 5 star review:)

content: I am in love with this game. It speaks to my own passionate game ideas, I just wish I could get my ideas out of my head the way this fine, talented Dev has. I don't care if my tablet can't handle the game with Max settings, I can see the beauty hiding underneath the blur. The visuals, the sound effects, the soundtrack, the world and it's myriad of strange and wonderful creatures... Again, I am in love with this game. Please, everyone support this Dev and give him your money! It is well deserved!
COOL GAME NICE VIEW ILIKE IT but plss ad sum new crature or monsters someting

First of all, I use the latest Huawei smartphone yet the graphics I get after opening the game or even after attempting to set the quality and still no change, I even tried to get a refund but the refund button suddenly doesn't work, I deleted the game despite being so exited about it after hearing about the game from others, so for me it's (-Star) = rating, but for those who want to try the game I say go ahead, it's a good game and all with minimum disappointment
I would rate the game higher if I could play it. But nothing will load
The camera makes the games to me unplayable. I tried several times adjusting the camera smh. The the guys are running through the ground. Fix that and I might buy it again

It was pretty fun for a mobile game. I loved the story and symbolism (Attended to be there or not) overall I'm happy too give $2 for the game. If only you had enemies to fight against while exploring the world it would have been well worth it.

I very rarely write reviews but this game has swayed me. It reminds me of all the best old school adventure games but with the freedom to go where you please. A pleasant game to explore, it never feels like a chore to climb a hill because I'm genuinely interested to see what's on the other side. Struggled with the camera at first but with customisable options I had it feeling right to me very easily. This is obviously a labour of love from a talented indie dev and it's well worth buying.

Has awesome background music and storyline. Have played for about 3 hours and been engrossed. This game manages a sufficient 3D environment on a mobile device. The only negative is that the onscreen controls are quite difficult to keep your character going in the direction intended, with the direction rapidly changing. I dropped the turn speed to try to make it manageable and it is still a problem. Even with the control issues, this game is one of the best available on the app store.

So far it's amazing, i wish you had the option to hide the jump and settings button as they are oled killers, if that was possible then it would be max stars for me , also performance is quite bad, looking at 25-30fps on the best available android specs at the moment, although i do understand why so i don't mind putting down the graphics, definitely recommend this game.
I love your games. Thank you. Keep up the fantastic work, very impressed yet again üëå
Keep going it only gets better. Great experience

Great graphics and somewhat interesting story. The problem I have is that there isn't much to the game. Most of the game is just following another character around until you get to a point where there is more dialogue. It may be an open world, but there really isn't much to do in the open world. It's still a very impressive game, I just wish there was more of it.
replyContent: Thanks for the review Tim - every star helps, and yeah Vandgels is definitely more sparse than BrightRidge, which is maybe a more "magical" game - live and learn, and Im glad you played my game anyways:) And if you haven't yet, maybe try the Dungeonette mode - there's 10 dungeons to solve with a prize in the final 11th dungeon.

content: This game deserves more than 500 characters so I'll be blunt. Nimian Legends: Vandgels is a bright shining jewel amongst an ocean of steaming dog excrement. If you buy this game, please remember it was made BY ONE PERSON. Give it a chance and let this guy keep your 4 dollars. Robert, if you read this, I want to personally thank you for putting yourself out there with games like this...don't stop. You've revitalized my drive to keep digging for gems like this in an infinite sea of garbage üòÄ
replyContent: I love bluntüòÑ thanks Robert - great name;) cheerleading like this makes a difference and is very supportive. I‚Äôm in the middle of creating the next games landscape and I stopped to check my phone and got your wonderful boost. I‚Äôll get back to it feeling happy and confident knowing someone enjoys it.

content: game sounds great, but since in the main menu has a sort of filter like a grade in all screen, I couldn't find anything in the graphic options witch is creating this bad look... I asked refund, my phone is a oneplus 5.. Thanks for your reply, btw, the game sounds really great, I will try other games that you have
replyContent: I'm very sorry about that. I aim for maximum compatibility but it doesn't always work out on every phone. Please email me and ill be happy to help you get a refund, and thank you for trying my game:)

content: A truly heart felt game with a great message. You can tell that a lot of love, time and effort went into this. I can't wait for more games from this dev.
replyContent: Your review came at a great time Robin:) There is so much hard work making these worlds, and sometimes I can get down about it. Knowing that it means something to someone really makes my work as a solo dev feel that much more meaningful. I create things so people can enjoy them and I am so glad you did.

content: Awesome pictures, for control maybe can fixed again.
replyContent: Thank you Novianto. Try Options-Controls and One Handed control or some of the other options in there. Controls were a big point of complaint for my game and because of feedback like this I have reworked all the controls and camera for my next one, so I appreciate you letting me know, and for playing Vandgels:)

content: This game is so lovely but for some reason I have a really hard time controlling her in any way...it's as though she is just moving too quickly for what I want her to and I just cannot get her to go where I want her to go :-( i looked to see if there was a way to change this issue somehow in the controls but there isn't and I genuinely want to give this game a higher rating because i adore the idea of it so hopefully I can find a way to play this game soon.
replyContent: Sorry about that Kari and thanks for trying my game.it will work with a gamepad if you have a wireless one. And controls-use one handed makes the camera spin less. My next game has rebuilt controls because it is one of the biggest complaints about my game and I‚Äôm sorry I can‚Äôt to more to fix it for now.

content: So i was browsing games on sale and came across this... I went through the reviews as per usual and saw a lot of good reviews and decided to give it a shot... Ive only played around with it for about 15 minutes so far but this is by far the best mobile game i have found yet, took a few moments to get used to the controls but they became fluid quickly, the graphics are amazing, and the gameplay seems to be pretty smooth. i cant wait to see what you come up with next, good work üëç
replyContent: Those controls frustrate many people so I am so glad you were able to work with them:) And I have improved the controls in my next game Wilderless in response to the feedback. Thanks for taking a chance on my game and seeing through the rough spots, and for the 5 stars which are basically like gold coins for indie devs like me:)

content: Amazing looking game. Easy to pick up and play. Also supports my 8bitdo gamepad. So does have controller support. Love the game. I do wish the combat was more refined but still a great game.
replyContent: so many people asked for 8bitdo support so I am glad that it is working:) I like to make simple worlds you can pick up and play and its cool that you found it easy to do that. Since I was a kid I liked creating fantasy worlds and its really great I have the chance to share them now with people like you.

content: Very satisfied with this, just like the other version. But both still need to be optimized a lot because the game consume the device's power like a beast
replyContent: I admit they sure do. They are pretty large worlds and that takes its toll, but Im reading as much as I can about optimization and I hope that I am getting better as I go along. Thanks for taking the time to leave your 5 star review Lucifer because it is just me here and that kind of support helps me a lot:)

content: 1 man dev!!! Amazing quality, lots of graphics toggles!!!! Most advanced game on the market. Would just ask to make more realistic player
replyContent: Thank you Mike:) Im glad you like all the options. Especially on mobile it makes sense to give players a lot of controls, and since I can't offer mods on mobile this kind of feels like a replacement for it. I love being able to start a snowstorm at the flick of a. button.

content: Interesting game after playing for a good 45 minutes, gamepad/mouse/keyboard support would most likely fix the control and camera issues, otherwise the game is solid. The quality settings are a fantastic option so I can set the graphics to what best suits my hardware. I'm excited to experience the adventure. Thanks!
replyContent: Thanks Bob for playing and reviewing my game:) There's no keypad/mouse support but there is support for most gamepads. Just pair your controller before you start the game. And I hear you (and everyone) about the controls, my next game has rebuilt intuitive controls from the ground up, plus you can customize in Vandgels in options-controls.

content: Amazing!!! Read beyond initial concerns. I got this game for a short flight to play offline and I was not impressed at all at first. I followed the recomended settings for graphics and the controls, camera, basically everything was janky and graphics not good. Game gives u controls over the UI and settings I am using a S9 and maxed alot of the settings turned of the camera follow and tweaked the UI. Graphics, all, amazing now. If u ake the time and get the settings right and you will have a GEM.
replyContent: This is an extra nice review Eric because you were able to find the diamond despite the rough, and im glad you stuck it out and let me know. My games are rough, handcrafted and im working to make the new ones a lot smoother with better controls, auto saving and lots more thanks to feedback like this. Thanks Eric:)

content: I dont know really what to say, this game... I just dont know man lmao is this even a game? Its beyond that for some reason, its beautiful in all sorts of aspects.
replyContent: That's cool because it started out as just a world without the game. Im most interested in creating worlds and finding the stories inside, and in making a place that feels natural and beautiful and I'm glad you can see the beauty in that:) Im working on more and my goal is a fully living breathing fantasy wilderness. Thanks Shade for the support.

content: Don't know what else to say but this was really worth the wait. Seeing your journey of making this game just from screenshots and now its finally available was truly mindblowing. I would definitely rate this higher than just 5 stars tbh because I really enjoy this way more than I expected which is awesome. This is one of those games that will never be repetitive whatsoever also the music in this game is really good and matches up well with the landscape and atmosphere of the game.Keep it up dev!
replyContent: It is cool isn't it to watch something grow from screenshots to final game:) I feel the same way, I don't have kids so maybe this is like my baby and I want to watch it grow. My next game is even larger and I think follows my goal to make a fully realized fantasy wilderness to explore and adventure in. Thanks for the support and I will keep it up:)

content: Is great to explore this amazing world
replyContent: Thank you! I love exploring in games -I grew up with games that were limited to hallways because of the computing power, so now being able to play open worlds, well its like spreading your wings:) My next game is literally more than 100 times the size of Vandgels so there'll be a lot more wilderness to explore.

content: It's the most beautiful world crafted game I ever experience I mean wow!! Very great game. I give it a 5 with a blink of my eye
replyContent: Thanks Devin - your kind words are my Christmas gift :) world building is one of my favourite things to do because I want to visit these other places and see something new, so I try to pull out of my head these places that exist inside of it and it‚Äôs cool to be able to share them and that people like you appreciate it.

content: I think you should make button control costumizeble , also mybe a noise reduction for low graphic device im using sm-note 3 low graphic to reduce lag . Its a great game great storyline i just started I wish you goodluck with ur job , I will get a good new phone to play and enjoy the game at the fullest graphic .. also it is fully offline which is really great and not consuming alot of battery .. Love it :) .. 1 more , camera sensitivity and aiming a bit hard for me but i will train more .
replyContent: Thanks Venom 95. Try Options-controls and Options-Camera - there might be options there that make the game easier to control. For my next game Wilderless I rebuilt the controls and camera because that was one of the biggest complaints:) Im also adding antialiasing to reduce noise as an option so I listen and appreciate the helpful feedback.

content: This game is a complete masterpiece! Heart pounding graphics. Every view is absolutely amazing. Good story line . I would give this game infinity amount of stars if I could. GREAT JOB !!!
replyContent: Five is more than enough:) Thanks so much for that because more stars means more support for me, which means I can keep working on bringing more of this world to life. Vandgels was a place in my head, this very religious winter world, and its cool I was finally able to create it. More worlds are coming too https://www.instagram.com/protopopgames/

content: Great game with great graphics surprised this was made by one person grear job to the creator i didnt get into the atory yet but it does look promising
replyContent: Thanks devonnair:) The story ramps up slowly but it does go somewhere and I hope you enjoy it and the world. There's also about ten dungeons hidden in there to solve too.

content: Amazing. Just like the last one was. Only complaint is I've seem to got stuck in a staircase at the Vandgels. Save points would be ideal. Unless I'm missing something.
replyContent: That's happened before and I apologize. Im not sure if you emailed me about this but for anyone stuck try Options-map-fast travel home to return to the castle bridge or restart the app (it auto saves and will start you nearby). Bugs are one of the hardest things in game design and im glad you still gave me 5 stars - thanks for that Shannon:)

content: I'm very impressed. This is really good!! I can tell you put a lot of time and love into this game!! Good job!!
replyContent: Thanks Pumpkin Momma :) I know it‚Äôs not super polished but I‚Äôm glad you can see I put a lot of hard work into it. Some days I didn‚Äôt think I could finish it but I love this fantasy world and I want to keep sharing more of it. Thanks for the five stars too because that is a great support to me.

content: This game amazing! Im suprise, someone who make this by him self, can make a game this good! I hope i could get a better phone so i can fully see the beautifull graphic. Keep up the good work üòÑ Im going to try out the other Vangels game after i finish this one :D
replyContent: Five stars - thank you Kaziin! A lot of people keep the game and try it again when they get a new phone and say it runs better so that‚Äôs a good strategy and I like the support:) thanks for looking at BrightRidge too. That was my first game and it has a special place in my heart, and some good music too I think.

content: Wow, and I though you couldn't get any better then Bright Ridge. Amazing work! So much has been improved in this sequel, yet it still carries the beauty of the first game. The story telling has been heavily improved, and there are even more ways to interact with the world this time around. The debate mini game was super cool and I love the combat improvements as well. Graphics are beautiful and the game seems to run much smoother then the original. To anyone reading, buy this NOW! It's amazing!
replyContent: There‚Äôs a lot I would change but also a lot I love too:) I‚Äôm glad I was able to add some different things like the debate scene - happy you likes that. I think I learned a lot and I‚Äôm looking forward to making my third game wilderless even better. Thank you very much for supporting me Hurricane Chaser and for playing both gamesüôÇ

content: Breathtaking fun, though in 3rd person veiw, still a head spin, even with sensitivity turned all the way down.1st person veiw better. We always support this dev, as the love and effort put into this game are UNBEATABLE for a 1 MAN TEAM, WELL DONE DEV, WELL DONE.
replyContent: My next game has really good 1st person built in from the start https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yVDs7PkBqeY . Now I realize how important 1st person is to so many people:) Thank you Juju for all of the support - doing this on my own means support comes from players, not publishers, so 5 stars and good reviews help me keep moving.

content: I've been eye balling this game for while and I just finally got it. I'm so glad I did. So far I've been playing for 10 minutes and I'm really enjoying it. I really like how the bushes and grass blow in the wind. Also I'm really happy there's no in app purchases. This is the old school game mechanic I like without being forced to pay a lot of money just to be able to achieve what you want. The character movement takes some getting used to cuz it's very sensitive but that's ok. Great game!
replyContent: Try Options-controls and maybe something will help with the movement - character controls one of the biggest issues and im always working on it:) Thank you Jay for the five star support - that is like gold to indie devs like me. I don't believe in putting barriers to game play so its just pay once, nice and simple and im glad you like that:)

content: I honestly loved this game and it's story it's easy to lose yourself in the world but the controls are a little touchy and gave me a little bit of issue I really do hope that you keep up the hard work and produce some more amazing games though was a great experience
replyContent: You're not alone about the controls Caramel - its one of my wekaspots and im working on it:) See if anything in Options-controls and Options-camera helps. I have a new game going called Wilderness that is an explorer focus and im doing a lot reading and research to learn more game skills, and thanks to the support and 5 stars I am staying motivated

content: Here's me thinking brightridge was amazing! This is even better! Don't know how just one person alone has done this! Incredible!!
replyContent: Thanks for supporting me Mark - I often have like no joke 1000+ things in my list and I just check it off one at a time and try not to get discouraged.And its fun to learn so much and make mistakes that I can grow from, making worlds is something I love to do and something I will keep trying to get better at, and I have new worlds coming soon:)

content: Considering that this is supposedly made by one person, The quality of work and effort that went into this is absolutely insane. The PC style graphics settings should be the blueprint for all 3D games... You can dial it down or turn up till your phone cries for mercy. lol This and its prequel are what you call console level games.
replyContent: Thanks Kay:) I like to give players lots of options so you can choose between speed and looks, plus my games are about exporing and freedom so the more you can customize the better. Your 5 star review helps me a lot, it‚Äôs the best way for me to reach more people and I‚Äôm glad you played:)

content: I am so happy to see this sequel to BrightRidge!! I haven't had the chance to play it all the way through but it is excellent so far. More of the same beautiful graphics, huge open world, and original unique story. I just wish I could have been a part of helping test and develop it! Thank you for this wonderful game!
replyContent: Thank you Matthew - It's great you're enjoying Vandgels and thanks for the support playing BrightRidge too. My goal is to work on games full time so I can really share some of the ideas I have, and each game brings me closer to that, and each wonderful 5 star review like this helps me reach more people, motivates me and closes in on my goal:)

content: One word for you : BEAUTIFUL
replyContent: I love one word reviews like this:) I like writing stories and characters, but I think in my heart my favourite part is just building beautiful natural feeling world and I am glad that comes through. I like a nice action game too, but there is something to be said for just sitting and watching the sun set. Thanks Joseph:)

content: This is a technical and artistic marvel (like brightridge). No other mobile game has come close in terms of bringing the world to life and making me just stare at the beauty of it. The story is awesome too from what I have played so far! I recommend this to everyone.
replyContent: Thanks Doctor Grumble (cool name:) You know there's a lot of parts that I wish were smoother, but overall I think Vandgels is at least something unique and I'm glad you see something in it too. It's taught me a lot and I'm hard at work on game #3 too armed with the knowledge. Vandgels is close to my heart and im happy you took the time to visit it!

content: As someone who is also a small indie team of two making a game, I'd have to say this is an amazing solo project. The amount of work that is required for these types of game to come to fruition is intense so hats off to you! Keep going strong!
replyContent: I totally get what you mean - its a real challenge to make games with such a small team and im sure you're as driven by passion as I am. The fun part is taking something that exists in your head and sharing it with people and hearing back from them. Thanks for the 5 star support (I makes a big difference) and good luck with your game too:)

content: Amazing that such a beautiful game comes in such a small download package. Just starting it, but if it's anything like the first, I'm in love.
replyContent: :) Thank you Josh for playing both my games. I think BrightRidge was more magical, but Vandgels is set in a real place in my head and although it starts slow, I think the story takes you somewhere. For my next game Wilderless I have taken all the feedback and thought about it for a long time and will be making something different and much bigger.

content: Awesome!
replyContent: Short and Sweet - thanks Jamilex for playing my game and for supporting me with the 5 stars:)

content: I loved the first one and I love this one as well üòç keep it up ü§ôü§ôü§ô
replyContent: I will Jesse, thank you. Im so glad people are trying my game and I've listened to all the feedback and am putting everything I am learning into my new game Wilderless. Each game is a great learning experience, and through it all I have a string desire to keep making and sharing these worlds as best I can:)

content: Love this game it's amazing great graphics and it's so good IV been waiting for this game to buy it I'm glad I did keep up the great work
replyContent: Thanks Jason:) I am glad to hear you were waiting for it. I remember when it was just an idea about 3 years ago and I can't believe I actually was able to finally bring it to life and share it. Im also taking all the feedback positive and negative and using it to make my next game Wilderless even better.

content: This is a work of art. Between the interesting concepts, world quality, and beautiful score, I'm really enjoying this title. The environment breaths and begs to be explored. Tons of camera and visual treatment options for tweaking, and controls are reasonably configurable as well. If you're a photography fan, this game is a lovely experience. So much to see wandering around; glad I stumbled across Vandgels in my browsing. I hope the developer has great success.
replyContent: I love that you picked up on the Photo Mode Kelly - that's something I want to expand on because exploring is really at the heart of my games:) Its funny because it was through the game camera that I learned how small field of view makes those landscape videos look so sweeping. Thank you for the support and the encouragement.

content: The photos and descriptions are 100% accurate. What you see is what you are getting, there is no trickery here. If you're looking for a game that is great to look at and roam around in, this is the one. I gave this game a REAL chance. I completed both the story mode and the "Dungeonette", and I can say with certainty the developer absolutely poured his heart and soul into this game. It does have a few bugs here and there, but no more than the average mobile title. Worth supporting the developer.
replyContent: Thanks for the support Mitchell and for giving Vandgels a real playthrough:) I worried that a lot of the stuff is kind of hidden in the game and it's cool that you tried the different odes. Im working on updates and learning as much as I can about game design to be better, and thanks for the review and rating - every star helps people like me:)
